discussion.p: "[Note: Pathnames containing spaces require special handling by the user to avoid truncation when read by the extractor. — end note]" sounds like a quoted manipulator as specified in the C++14 draft in [quoted.manip] would be useful.
Consider using quoted manipulators for stream insertion and extraction.
discussion.note: 2014-02-12 Applied LWG/SG-3 Issaquah wording tweak to use ISO doc number for reference to C++14.

blockquote.p:
Effects: os << quoted(p.string<charT, traits>()).
[Note: Pathnames containing spaces require special handling by the user to avoid truncation when read by the extractor. — end note]
[Note: The quoted function is described in ISO 14882:2014 §27.7.6. — end note]
Returns: os
